nodes.bodyText:
Maybe this is incorrect, but my understanding of the IdentityLink documentation is that the type can be any String and those enum-values are just the ones the engine can handle by default.
If this is the case we would restrict this endpoint to only those three types.

I will remove the enumValues and reference the engine-native values in the description.

nodes.bodyText:
I'll use this line to reply to the general review comment:
Yes, the IdentityLinkDto properties are documented in three different ways in the endpoints. That's why I decided to generalize them. This one varies the most.

As I mentioned, I will expand the description, by adding the default engine relationships (and remove the enumValues).

Regarding the required type, we actually do validate the presence of the property, it's just buried pretty deep in the code 😄. You can find the validations here:

https://github.com/camunda/camunda-bpm-platform/blob/master/engine/src/main/java/org/camunda/bpm/engine/impl/cmd/AddIdentityLinkCmd.java#L60
https://github.com/camunda/camunda-bpm-platform/blob/master/engine/src/main/java/org/camunda/bpm/engine/impl/cmd/DeleteIdentityLinkCmd.java#L61
